intro: Webera pavettoides, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
